metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18513 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A crash can occur when processing a crafted S/MIME message or an XPI package containing a crafted signature. This can be used as a denial-of-service (DOS) attack because Thunderbird reopens the last seen message on restart, triggering the crash again. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
